info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 3:01PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MERCER... SOUTHWESTERN VENANGO...NORTHERN LAWRENCE AND NORTH CENTRAL BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM EDT... At 301 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Oakwood, or 8 miles north of East Palestine, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... New Castle, Grove City, New Wilmington, Oakwood, New Castle Northwest, Mercer, Bessemer, Harrisville, Plain Grove Township, Jackson Center, Barkeyville, and Volant. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 109 and 122. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 13 and 28. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 6 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western, northwestern and west central Pennsylvania.
